sense.gloss: to throw into disorder, to disarrange, to disturb (order, peace, etc.), to corrupt (public morals), to dishevel (hair)
to be disordered, to be disarranged, to be disarrayed, to be disheveled, to be dishevelled
to be discomposed, to be upset, to get confused, to be disturbed
to lapse into chaos (due to war, etc.)
disorder, confusion, disturbance (of order, peace, etc.), corruption (e.g. of public morals)
laxity in official discipline, civil service corruption
laxity in official discipline, public order being in disarray
